Your copy of Link Bubble has been illegally modified and thus will not work reliably. Please reinstall from the Play Store.
No default browser found on the system.
How can I quickly close a tab?
Pressing the hardware Back button is the fastest way. Flicking a tab onto the Close button is another good way.
I think pressing the Back button should minimize the browser!

Minimizing Link Bubble when the hardware Back button is pressed is not feasible. Consider the following case:
1). example.com/page1 is loaded in the first tab.
2). You click a link on this page, and load example.com/page2 in the same tab.
3). You now want to go back to the link in step 1.

How do you do this if pressing the hardware Back button minimizes Link Bubble? Pressing the tiny back indicator on the tab itself is not feasible.

Link Bubble is a browser, and Android browsers have a long since established standard of either going back in the URL stack, or if no such stack exists, closing the current page when the Back button is pressed. Link Bubble follows this standard.

There are 3 causes of this:
1). A browser other thank Link Bubble is set as your default system browser. See the \"Set default system browser\" option in Link Bubble\'s Settings to change this.
2). Link Bubble has been configured not to intercept links from your current app. See the \"Intercept links from\" option in Link Bubble\'s Settings.
3). Apps such as Talon, Reddit is Fun and others have inbuilt browsers that render links. Check the settings of that app and enable \"External browser\" or deselect \"Integrated browser\" or similar.

Note: other browser apps such as Chrome are hardcoded to load links in themselves, and thus Link Bubble is unable to load links clicked from other browser apps.
How do I use Reading Mode? Why do some links not work?

Firstly, ensure Reading Mode is enabled (Settings -> App Controls / More… -> Reading Mode).

From that point, when Reading Mode is available for the current tab, the Reading Mode icon will display on the action bar (next to the Share button). Be aware that this icon only appears after the link has finished loading, and only if Link Bubble successfully extracted content for Article Mode from the link.

Note: Extracting content from the web is an unreliable process, and may not work 100% accurately. Given the dynamic and ever-changing nature of the web itself, there is little than can be done here.
Will you add support for bookmarks, favorites, extensions, etc.?
Never say never, but for now Link Bubble is focused solely on being the best possible way of loading and consuming links loaded from other apps.
Can I help translate the app?

I hope to add translation support soon.

When I do, I will definitely put a call out on Google+ (+Link Bubble) for help with translations, so be sure to keep an eye on my feed.
Do you publish a feature roadmap? Can I up-vote upcoming features?
For competitive reasons, the answer to both of these questions is \'no\' I\'m afraid.

Link Bubble only supports purchases via Google Play at this time.

Additional payment methods will hopefully be added in the future (assuming they do not violate the Google Play Developer Program Policies).
Why can\'t I type the name of the link I want to visit?

This is entirely as intended. Link Bubble is designed not to be a complete replacement for your browser, but to instead be used to load and display links from other apps as elegantly, helpfully and as quickly as possible.

If you want to load a new url in Link Bubble, searching for a page via Google Now and loading the result with Link Bubble is a great way of doing so.

For quickly loading your favorites, I find the Chrome Bookmarks widget very helpful.
Why can\'t I copy text from a web page?

Unfortunately Android system limitations prevent this from working.

Technical answer: Copy functionality works when using Android\'s WebView from an Activity, but not from a Service (which Link Bubble uses).
Why doesn\'t the app draw over the translucent status bar?
Unfortunately Android system limitations prevent this.
Is there a beta programme? How can I join?
Details on the beta programme will be announced in due course. Keep an eye on my Google+ (+Link Bubble) feed for announcements.
Why does Link Bubble run slowly on my Nexus S / Galaxy S1 / Moto G class device?

Link Bubble is a very resource intensive app, and consequently devices with lower specs can struggle to run the app as well as more powerful devices. Future updates will aim to improve Link Bubble\'s performance, but there is only so much that can realistically be done here.

Technical answer: At the bare minimum, Link Bubble requires the use of a Service and a WebView in order to function. Often multiple WebViews and even multiple Activities are also present. Naturally, allocating these items (especially the WebViews) consumes a lot of memory/resources. Lower spec devices generally have less memory available than Link Bubble requires, and thus performance suffers as garbage collections are frequently triggered. As an example, the max heap size on the Nexus S is 48MB, compared to 192MB on the Nexus 5.
Sometimes web pages don\'t display correctly or videos don\'t play.

Link Bubble uses the standard Android WebView, but unfortunately it is sometimes unreliable. Alternative web rendering methods such as FireFox\'s GeckoView and Chromium will likely be investigated going forward.

In the event a web page doesn\'t display correctly in Link Bubble, the easiest thing to do is just to load a traditional browser for that link.
Why does the ongoing notification always display when Link Bubble is running?
Unfortunately this ongoing notification is necessary to encourage the Android OS not to terminate Link Bubble.
When is the next update coming?

When it\'s ready!

It\'s not feasible to be any more specific than that unfortunately (even to provide a ballpark estimate).

The reality is, when estimates are given people often end up taking them as a commitment, and can get upset if/when a release slips for whatever reason.
How can I quickly stop Link Bubble from running?
Swipe from the top of the screen to open the notifications pane and click the \"Link Bubble\" notification.
How can I remove Link Bubble as the default browser?
System Settings -> Apps -> Downloaded -> Link Bubble -> Clear defaults.
Question about the app? Try here.
By continuing, you acknowledge that you accept the Link Bubble terms and privacy policy.
Link Bubble is an all-new browser designed and crafted solely with mobile devices in mind.

Features include: • When you click on a link in an app, Link Bubble loads that web page in the background, leaving you free to keep using your current app rather than your precious time being wasted watching a page load. Once the page has fully loaded, it will animate on screen. • Link Bubble\'s flick physics allow you to go from clicking a link to sharing a link or adding it to a service such as Pocket in little more than a second! • Load multiple links from your current app at the same time. • Gracefully handles links that redirect to other apps. No longer does clicking an Instagram link in Twitter redirect to a full screen browser before loading Instagram! • Deep integration with the apps on your system. • Locates embedded YouTube videos on web pages, and provides a shortcut to load those videos directly in the YouTube app. • Handy stats that illustrate how much time you are saving by using Link Bubble.

Regarding the Location permission: This is required so that you might grant permission for a website to access your location (such as those with an embedded map). Link Bubble itself never accesses your location.
Click a link in an app.
A bubble will appear on the edge of the screen and the link will begin loading in the background. As soon as the page is loaded, it will be displayed.
It\'s that simple! With Link Bubble, you can keep using your current app rather than wasting your time watching links redirect and waiting for pages to load. What\'s not to love about that?
You can also quickly share a link or add it to an app such as Pocket:
Looks both fun and useful right?
Redirects links to a dedicated app (E.g., Instagram).
Finds embedded videos so you can easily load them in the YouTube app.
PS. To close this bubble, either press the Back button or long press the bubble and flick it onto the Close bubble.
